subtitle: Here is how to protect yourself
description: Here is how to protect yourself
title: Can I avoid malaria?
content:
Created by BabyCenter

Malaria can make you and your baby very sick. You may become anaemic - this is when you do not have enough iron in your blood, which makes you short of breath and weak. 

Here are some ways to protect yourself and your baby from malaria:

•	Sleep under an insecticide-treated bed net, even if the weather is hot.

•	Mosquitoes are attracted to dark colours. Wear light-coloured clothing, especially if you go out in the 
evening.

•	Stop mosquitoes getting to your skin by wearing long sleeves and full-length clothes. 

•	If possible, use a spray against mosquitoes or mosquito coils in the house. 

•	Mosquitoes live in stagnant water, rotting leaves and damp areas. Check that there are none of these around your home.

The health facility may give you medicine to take to help prevent malaria.  But remember that this medicine will not cure malaria if you have already got it.
